item.title: U.S. Inflation Isn't Getting Worse (or Better). Keep Watching Motor Vehicles.
item.description:
The U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) in November was 6.8% higher than in November 2020. That‚Äôs the fastest yearly rate of inflation since the early 1980s‚Äîand much faster than the prevailing rate of inflation as recently as this spring. It sounds bad, but it shouldn‚Äôt‚Äîyet‚Äîbe a cause for policy action to restrain consumer spending. Prices should stop spiking once (if?) the pandemic is brought under control globally‚Ä¶

URL: https://theovershoot.co/p/us-inflation-isnt-getting-worse-or?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In Praise of Azeem Azhar, "The Exponential Age: How Accelerating Technology is Transforming Business, Politics & Society "; & BRIEFLY NOTED: For 2021-12-12 Su

item.title: Dire straits
item.description:
A conversation that I have with some regularity these days begins when someone mentions China. One of us will bring it up, and we‚Äôll both kind of let out a whistle as we mention all the things that seem...troubling about its current state and then we each shrug and, statistically, go buy stocks with tons of exposure to the Chinese economy. This insoucia‚Ä¶

source: Appreciating & Reviewing Patrick Wyman: The Verge; & BRIEFLY NOTED: 2021-12-11 Sa
